poem:
Energy Equilibrium

In the currents of light—  
where south-eastern whispers  
once bore the weight of golden coins—  
a single charge hums,  
binding country by unbroken spark.  
  
Fairness distilled in wires,  
not the zones of one's abode,  
quietly weaving an even song  
across hedgerows and hills,  
now alight, united  
under a shared, simple sky.
